content:
Nice clash, but the statement is pretty long and confusing so I think a lot of clashers are struggling. I managed to finish it after about 12 minutes in Shortest mode. No other human players got more than 33% though.

The below part of the statement seems very unnecessary and makes it harder to understand the problem, imo:

Winning Result:
- A number is drawn within the given fixed range of each cell (except free cell), to determine the winning result.
- It is drawn in a sequence from left to right, top to bottom.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good clash :D

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the idea :smile:

The way bingo is played, there could be several numbers picked within a single range (e.g. multiple 1-15 for first B column). The way this game appears to be played, only one number is drawn from each range. It is rather important to know that the listed card and winning numbers are in correspondence, as it could avoid some unnecessarily complex solutions.

Interesting CoC. Personally I miss an explanation of the winning result. Something like "In each cell of a card, the number is compared to a winning number. If it is equal, the cell is matched." under the graphical representation of the card. I would rephrase "A line is consider bingo" as "A line is counted as bingo"
I understand using 0 in the center of the card, but why use 0 as a winning number? Shouldn't the "free" cell always be "won"?

hey Codingamer or developer of this clash i want to say many time 1 that can give easy them 40-50% to other codingamers change it if you want upvote from other codingamer or from me otherwise i like the idea and give upvote after you improved testcases section. :smile:

Thanks for the comment, but I'm not quite sure if I understand your questions.

There's no specific reason for using the number "0" to represent the free cell. It can be any number as long as its not within the range of 1 to 40. 

The free cell is always won, hence both the "card" and "winning_number" inputs share the same number, in place of the free cell.

Thanks for the suggestion!
I will try to think about how to add in the info for winning result.

Do you mean that under the "Problem" section, the "winning result" wasn't clear that it is correspondence?

Thanks! I will think about it.

Maybe the best way to explain it, is to state that one number is drawn for each cell. This is what leads to a correspondence between the card and the winning numbers, which right now is only evident from the test case. Seeing this puzzle with only an understanding of bingo, one might assume that the drawings could be in any order (since bingo game can start with a number in the middle N column, for instance).
Ah, I see. I think I understood what you are saying. Thanks!
Oh, I see, you always put 0 in the winning numbers, so it is in fact always won. Nevermind, scratch that.
